00015 huffman_table bits_huffman[2];
00016 huffman_table time_huffman;
00017 BOOL should_compress_tdc400 = TRUE;

00019 void tdc400_optimize()
00020 {
00021   huffman_optimize_tree(&time_huffman);
00022   huffman_optimize_tree(&bits_huffman[0]);
00023   huffman_optimize_tree(&bits_huffman[1]);
00024  
00025   save_huffman("/Compression/Lossless/TDC400/Huffman/Time", &time_huffman);
00026   save_huffman("/Compression/Lossless/TDC400/Huffman/Bits 0", &bits_huffman[0]);
00027   save_huffman("/Compression/Lossless/TDC400/Huffman/Bits 1", &bits_huffman[1]);
00028 }

00030 void tdc400_load()
00031 {
00032   huffman_init_default(&time_huffman, 128);
00033   huffman_init_default(&bits_huffman[0], 128);
00034   huffman_init_default(&bits_huffman[1], 128);
00035 
00036   load_huffman("/Compression/Lossless/TDC400/Huffman/Time", &time_huffman);
00037   load_huffman("/Compression/Lossless/TDC400/Huffman/Bits 0", &bits_huffman[0]);
00038   load_huffman("/Compression/Lossless/TDC400/Huffman/Bits 1", &bits_huffman[1]);
00039 
00040   int size = sizeof(BOOL);
00041   db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Compression/Lossless/TDC400/Enabled", &should_compress_tdc400,
00042     &size, TID_BOOL, TRUE);
00043 }

00045 void binary_print(unsigned char c)
00046 {
00047   for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
00048     if (c & 0x80) {
00049       printf("X");
00050     } else {
00051       printf(".");
00052     }
00053 
00054     c = c << 1;
00055   }
00056 }

00058 void event_display(tdc400_word * input, int length)
00059 {
00060   for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00061     printf("%d ", input[i].time);
00062 
00063     for (int j = 0; j < 6; j++) {
00064       binary_print(tdc400_byte(input[i], j));
00065       printf(" ");
00066     }
00067 
00068     printf("\n");
00069   }
00070 
00071   printf("------------------------------------------------------------\n");
00072 }
00073 
00074 int encode_times(tdc400_word * input, int input_size, io_buffer * output)
00075 {
00076   // 
00077   // Perform a variant of run-length encoding on the times in the TDC400
00078   // data, which are the most significant 16 bits in every 64 bit word.
00079   // 
00080   // Times typically come in blocks of consecutive words, where the
00081   // block 
00082   // length is generally of order 20.  We will store the time of the 
00083   // start of the block followed by the number of elements in the block.
00084   // 
00085   // More precisely, this is what we do:
00086   // - Take the difference of the first time of the current block
00087   // from the first time of the previous block.
00088   // - If the difference is less than 256, store a 0; otherwise, store a 1
00089   // 
00090   // - Store either 8 or 16 bits of time difference information.
00091   // - Store Huffman-coded run length.
00092   // 
00093 
00094   int run_length = 1;
00095   unsigned short prev_time = 0;
00096   unsigned short prev_run_time = 0;
00097 
00098   for (int i = 0; i < input_size; i++) {
00099     unsigned short this_time = input[i].time;
00100 
00101     if (this_time == prev_time + 1 && i != 0 && run_length < 127) {
00102       run_length++;
00103     } else {
00104       if (i != 0) {
00105 #if 0
00106         if (run_length >= 8) {
00107           event_display(&input[i - run_length], run_length);
00108         }
00109 #endif
00110         huffman_put_symbol(&time_huffman, output, run_length);
00111       }
00112       run_length = 1;
00113 
00114       unsigned short this_run_time_diff = this_time - prev_run_time;
00115       if (this_run_time_diff < 256) {
00116         io_buffer_put(output, this_run_time_diff, 9);
00117       } else {
00118         io_buffer_put(output, 0x00010000 | this_run_time_diff, 17);
00119       }
00120       output->num_codes++;
00121 
00122       prev_run_time = this_time;
00123     }
00124 
00125     prev_time = this_time;
00126   }
00127 
00128   huffman_put_symbol(&time_huffman, output, run_length);
00129 
00130   return flush_output_buffer(output);
00131 }
00132 
00133 void decode_times(io_buffer * input, tdc400_word * output)
00134 {
00135   // 
00136   // Reverse the encoding performed by encode_times.
00137   // 
00138 
00139   int num_words_in = input->num_codes / 2;
00140   int output_size = 0;
00141   unsigned short prev_run_time = 0;
00142 
00143   for (int i = 0; i < num_words_in; i++) {
00144     int first_time_length_flag = io_buffer_get(input, 1);
00145     unsigned short first_time;
00146     if (first_time_length_flag) {
00147       first_time = io_buffer_get(input, 16);
00148     } else {
00149       first_time = io_buffer_get(input, 8);
00150     }
00151 
00152     int run_length = huffman_get_symbol(&time_huffman, input);
00153 
00154     for (int j = 0; j < run_length; j++) {
00155       output[output_size++].time = first_time + prev_run_time + j;
00156     }
00157 
00158     prev_run_time += first_time;
00159   }
00160 }
00161 
00162 int encode_bits(tdc400_word * input, int input_size, io_buffer * output)
00163 {
00164   // 
00165   // Perform bitwise run-length encoding on the bit mask portion of 
00166   // the TDC400 data.  For example, the following bit pattern:
00167   // 
00168   // t 000000000011100000000000000000000000000000000000 
00169   // t+1 000000000000110000000000000000000000000000000000
00170   // 
00171   // which is not altogether improbable, would be encoded as
00172   // 
00173   // 10, 3, 47, 2, 34
00174   // 
00175   // Then, store Huffman codes for the run lengths.  Use a separate
00176   // Huffman table for the "zero" runs and the "one" runs.
00177   // 
00178 
00179   rle_state s = { 0, 0, {128, 128}, 0, bits_huffman };
00180 
00181   for (int i = 0; i < input_size; i++) {
00182     for (int j = 0; j < 6; j++) {
00183       unsigned char b = tdc400_byte(input[i], j);
00184       rle_put(b, &s, output);
00185     }
00186   }
00187 
00188   return flush_rle(&s, output);
00189 }
00190 
00191 void decode_bits(io_buffer * input, tdc400_word * output, int output_size)
00192 {
00193   rle_state s = { 1, 0, {128, 128}, 0, bits_huffman };
00194 
00195   for (int i = 0; i < output_size; i++) {
00196     for (int j = 0; j < 6; j++) {
00197       int b = rle_get(input, &s);
00198       if (b >= 0) {
00199         tdc400_byte(output[i], j) = (unsigned char) b;
00200       } else {
00201         return;
00202       }
00203     }
00204   }
00205 }
00206 
00207 int tdc400_compress(tdc400_word * input, int input_size,
00208                     unsigned char *output, int userParam)
00209 {
00210   // 
00211   // Carry out lossless compression on the TPC data recorded by a
00212   // single TDC400.
00213   // 
00214 
00215   input_size /= sizeof(tdc400_word);
00216 
00217   rle_bits_setup();
00218 
00219   io_buffer output_buffer;
00220 
00221   // store size of input data
00222   int *uncompressed_size_p = (int *) output;
00223   *uncompressed_size_p = input_size;
00224   output += sizeof(int);
00225 
00226   // reserve space for the size of the compressed times
00227   int *compressed_time_size_p = (int *) output;
00228   output += sizeof(int);
00229 
00230   // compress times
00231   start_output_buffer(&output_buffer, output);
00232   int compressed_time_size =
00233       encode_times(input, input_size, &output_buffer);
00234   output += compressed_time_size;
00235 
00236   // store size of compressed times
00237   *compressed_time_size_p = compressed_time_size;
00238 
00239   // reserve space for the size of the compressed bit patterns
00240   int *compressed_bits_size_p = (int *) output;
00241   output += sizeof(int);
00242 
00243   // compress bit patterns
00244   start_output_buffer(&output_buffer, output);
00245   int compressed_bits_size =
00246       encode_bits(input, input_size, &output_buffer);
00247   output += compressed_time_size;
00248 
00249   // store size of compressed bit patterns 
00250   *compressed_bits_size_p = compressed_bits_size;
00251 
00252   return compressed_time_size + compressed_bits_size + 3 * sizeof(int);
00253 }
00254 
00255 int tdc400_expand(unsigned char *input, int input_size,
00256                   tdc400_word * output, int userParam)
00257 {
00258   // 
00259   // Uncompress the data produced by tdc400_compress().
00260   // 
00261 
00262   rle_bits_setup();
00263 
00264   // Get uncompressed data size
00265   int *uncompressed_size_p = (int *) input;
00266   int uncompressed_size = *uncompressed_size_p;
00267   input += sizeof(int);
00268   input_size -= sizeof(int);
00269 
00270   // Get size of compressed time data
00271   int *compressed_time_size_p = (int *) input;
00272   int compressed_time_size = *compressed_time_size_p;
00273   input += sizeof(int);
00274   input_size -= sizeof(int);
00275 
00276   // Uncompress times
00277   io_buffer input_buffer;
00278   start_input_buffer(&input_buffer, input);
00279   decode_times(&input_buffer, output);
00280   input += compressed_time_size;
00281   input_size -= compressed_time_size;
00282 
00283   // Get size of compressed bit patterns
00284   int *compressed_bits_size_p = (int *) input;
00285   int compressed_bits_size = *compressed_bits_size_p;
00286   input += sizeof(int);
00287   input_size -= sizeof(int);
00288 
00289   // Uncompress bit patterns
00290   start_input_buffer(&input_buffer, input);
00291   decode_bits(&input_buffer, output, uncompressed_size);
00292 
00293   return uncompressed_size * sizeof(tdc400_word);
00294 }
